intro: Scabiosa columbaria var. gramuntia, commonly known as the pink scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
